options.text: FortiGate Deployment Type - Single VM

basics.name: adminUsername
basics.label: FortiGate administrative username
basics.toolTip: Username for the FortiGate virtual appliance. Most not be root, administrator or admin

validations.message: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long
Usernames must not include reserved words
Usernames must not include reserved words

constraints.validationMessage: The password must be between 12 characters or longer, and contain characters from at least 3 of the following groups: uppercase characters, lowercase characters, numbers, and special characters excluding '\' or '-'.

basics.name: fortiGateNamePrefix
basics.label: FortiGate Name Prefix
basics.toolTip: Naming prefix for all deployed resources

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1 to 15 characters.

elements.name: fortiGateImageSKU_x64
elements.label: Fortigate-VM License Type
elements.defaultValue: Bring Your Own License or FortiFlex
elements.toolTip: Identifies whether to to use PAYG (on demand licensing) or BYOL license model (where license is purchased separately)

allowedValues.label: Bring Your Own License or FortiFlex

elements.name: fortiGateImageVersion_x64
elements.label: Fortigate Image Version
elements.toolTip: Only 6.x has the A/P HA feature currently

options.text: For this FortiGate deployment, it is recommended to use the general purpose or compute optimized virtual machines. A selection of supported instances sizes is listed in our documentation.

elements.name: selection_x64
elements.label: Size
elements.toolTip: Select the instance size of your FortiGate VM solution. Minimum 4 NICs are required.

options.text: Dsv6 and Esv6 Instance families require a Gen2 VM Image, support for MANA network drivers and are incompatible with the selected FortiGate version, please select version 7.6.1 or higher

elements.name: fortiGateImageSKU_arm64
elements.label: Fortigate-VM License Type
elements.defaultValue: Bring Your Own License or FortiFlex
elements.toolTip: Identifies whether to to use PAYG (on demand licensing) or BYOL license model (where license is purchased separately)

allowedValues.label: Bring Your Own License or FortiFlex

elements.name: fortiGateImageVersion_arm64
elements.label: Fortigate Image Version
elements.toolTip: Only 6.x has the A/P HA feature currently

options.text: For this FortiGate deployment, it is recommended to use the general purpose or compute optimized virtual machines. A selection of supported instances sizes is listed in our documentation.

elements.name: selection_arm64
elements.label: Size
elements.toolTip: Select the instance size of your FortiGate VM solution. Minimum 4 NICs are required.

options.text: Deploy FortiGate VMs in an availability set or availability zone.

elements.name: availabilityOptions
elements.label: Availability Option
elements.toolTip: Deploy FortiGate VMs in a new or existing availability set or or a specific availability zone.

elements.name: availabilitySetNew
elements.label: Create a new availability set?
elements.toolTip: Check this box if you want to create a new availability set and add the FortiGate VM to it.

elements.name: availabilitySetSelector
elements.label: Select the availability set for your FortiGate
elements.toolTip: Select your existing availability set you want to add this FortiGate VM to

options.text: The FortiGate VM and availability set are required to exist in the same resource group.

elements.name: availabilityZoneSelector
elements.label: Select the availability zone for your FortiGate VM
elements.toolTip: Select the availability zone for your FortiGate VM

options.text: If availability zone deployment is selected but the location does not support availability zone an availability set will be deployed. If availability zone deployment is selected and availability zone are available in the location, FortiGate A will be placed in Zone 1, FortiGate B will be placed in Zone 2
Bring Your Own License was selected in the basics blade. The license file(s) retrieved from support.fortinet.com can be uploaded here or uploaded after deployment.

elements.name: fgtLicenseFortiFlexCheck
elements.label: My organization is using the FortiFlex subscription service.
elements.toolTip: Select this box to enter a FortiFlex token

elements.name: fgtcontent
elements.label: FortiGate License
elements.toolTip: Upload the license file for the FortiGate BYOL here.

elements.name: fgtfortiflex
elements.label: FortiGate FortiFlex
elements.toolTip: FortiGate FortiFlex license token

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters and a dash are allowed, and the value must be 1 to 64 characters.

options.text: Pay As You Go licenses was selected in the basics blade and provisioned automatically during deployment. Registration of the PAYG license is required to receive support.
Migration between BYOL and PAYG is possible using a redeployment of the VM.

elements.name: fgtvmname
elements.label: Name of the FortiGate VM
elements.toolTip: Provide the name of the FortiGate VM. This is not required as a field.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters and a dash are allowed, and the value must be 1 to 64 characters.

options.text: Create a new or select an existing virtual network with the required subnets.

toolTip.virtualNetwork: Virtual Network for deployment of the FortiGate VM solution
toolTip.subnets: Standard deployment is to have an external and internal subnet

options.text: The external subnet will have a public IP attached to the FortiGate network interface. The internal subnet is a transit subnet containing only the FortiGate interfaces for traffic to and from the internal networks. Internal systems should be installed in a protected subnet with user defined route configuration.
Enables SR-IOV support allowing direct access from the NIC in the Azure infrastructure to the FortiGate VM.

elements.name: acceleratednetworking
elements.label: Accelerated Networking
elements.toolTip: Accelerated Networking enables direct connection between the VM and network card. Only available on 2 CPU F/Fs and 4 CPU D/Dsv2, D/Dsv3, E/Esv3, Fsv2, Lsv2, Ms/Mms and Ms/Mmsv2

options.text: Accelerated Networking is supported on most general purpose and compute-optimized instance sizes with 2 or more vCPUs. On instances that support hyperthreading, Accelerated Networking is supported on VM instances with 4 or more vCPUs. Deployment with the accelerated networking feature enabled on a host that doesn't support it will result in a failure to connect to it. The accelerated networking can be disabled after deployment from the Azure Portal or Azure CLI.

elements.name: acceleratedconnectionscheck
elements.label: Accelerated Connections feature (PREVIEW)
elements.toolTip: This option enables the Accelerated Connections feature. provides higher bandwidth at an additional cost

elements.name: acceleratedconnectionssku
elements.label: Auxiliary SKU - Bandwidth Tiers
elements.toolTip: This option selects the required bandwidth capability. SKUs incur additional cost when selected.

options.text: This feature is currently in Preview, please contact Fortinet at 'azuretech@fortinet.com'. Verify the limitations with Microsoft on supported regions. Currently Dv5 instance types are not supported.
The public IP will be used for public services hosted on the FortiGate such as IPSEC termination, management of the FortiGate from external or services behind the FortiGate such as a webserver.

toolTip.publicIpAddress: Public IP attached to FortiGate VM
toolTip.domainNameLabel: DNS name linked to this public IP

options.text: This deployment defaults to standard SKU public IP's. On September 30, 2025, Basic SKU public IPs will be retired. Microsoft Azure offers a migration path from a basic to standard SKU public IP.
Connect to FortiManager

elements.name: enabled
elements.label: Connect to FortiManager
elements.toolTip: FortiManager needs to be reachable from port 1 or port 2 of the FortiGate

elements.name: fortimanagerip
elements.label: FortiManager IP address
elements.toolTip: Provide up to 10 IP addresses or DNS names of the FortiManager reachable over port TCP/541

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters and dots, dashs and spaces are allowed, and the value must be 1 to 512 characters.

elements.name: fortimanagerserial
elements.label: FortiManager Serial Number
elements.toolTip: Provide the serial number of the primary FortiManager

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters and a dash are allowed, and the value must be 1 to 64 characters.

options.text: Pass a configuration file into the virtual machine while it is being provisioned. This is additional to the configuration for this architecture.

elements.name: config
elements.label: Custom Data
elements.toolTip: Custom Data
elements.placeholder: Add you required additional configuration here.

options.text: The default configuration already included in this deployment can be found on our github page.

elements.name: enabled
elements.label: Enable Serial Console
elements.toolTip: Enables the serial console.

elements.name: customvhdcheck
elements.label: Use Azure compute gallery VHD for deployment
elements.toolTip: This option enables the Internet inbound use case and creates additional routing infrastructure

options.text: For BYOL it is possible to upload a specific FortiGate image to Azure provided by support. Provide the resource ID of the required VM image version in the field below.

elements.name: resourceid
elements.label: Azure Compute Gallery Image Version resource ID
elements.toolTip: Azure Compute Gallery Image Version resource ID

elements.name: tagsByResource
elements.toolTip: Add tags to Azure Resources
